file.title: Back color1

p.text: It is the main color of the object.

p.textAll:
All colors can be specified in words (red, blue, black). Learn more about them in the section Quick fill words -> Colors. Or you can specify a color in a special form where you input a tint of the red color, then in semi-colon the titnt of the green color and again in a semi-colon the tint of the blue color. Maximum intensity is 255, minimum is 0. For example:
"255; 0; 0;" = red "0; 0; 255;" = blue "0; 0; 0;" = black "255; 255; 255;" = white "255; 255; 128;" = pale yellow

remarks.text: If you want to make a color transparent (not all objects has this function) then specify for its property the value "Nothing" or "".

sample.sampletitle: Variants of how main window color can be set:
sample.samplecode: Window1.Window1.Color = red Window1.Window1.Color = "255; 201; 128;" Window1.Window1.Color = "128;128;0;" Window1.Window1.Color = Window1.Button1.Fore color
